title: Financial Reporting Team Leader - Alternative Investments
jobDescription:
At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!

What You Can Expect At BBH:

If you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.

The Financial Reporting Team Leader draws upon past experience, knowledge and expertise to supervise analyst's preparation of and/or draft and review of annual financial statements, regulatory filings such as CIMA filings for private debt funds.  The individual is also responsible for systems enhancements as they relate to financial reporting needs and development of the group as a whole.

Responsibilities:

  • Supervise, coordinate, review and/or prepare annual and quarterly financial statements, regulatory filings such as CIMA filings for private debt funds.

  • Serve as an escalation point in assisting team members with problem solving and issue resolution; utilize best judgment to escalate issues to senior managers as appropriate.

  • Maintain a working familiarity with applicable laws, regulations and interpretation of governing financial statements and disclosure, including the Investment Company Act of 1940, the Internal Revenue Code, GAAP and other applicable requirements.

  • Coordinate fund audits with all applicable internal and external parties.

  • Communicate appropriately with other department members as well as the Fund Reporting Manager with respect to all timetables, workflows and relevant matters.

  • Perform special projects as directed by the Fund Reporting Manager.

  • Maintain knowledge related to regulatory changes affecting funds.

  • Assist in the implementation of proprietary and external systems, as needed.

  • Evaluate and develop enhancements to BBH Accounting system (Eagle STAR) and Financial Reporting system (Unity) to automate procedures for financial reporting purposes.

  • Identify and implement improvements in the financial reporting process.

  • Complete and oversee the completion of the BBH annual performance review process for assigned analysts.

  • Maintain a leadership role by developing internal relationships with key people in other departments to accomplish goals and resolve issues.

  • Provide ongoing feedback and coaching to staff to improve individual and team performance.

  • Participate in the recruiting and hiring process for new staff.

Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree in accounting or equivalent discipline and/or equivalent work experience.

  • 7+ years of alternative and/or mutual fund industry experience including at least four years of direct financial reporting experience.

  • Prior supervisory experience strongly preferred.

  • Highly organized, detail oriented.

  • Self-motivated, capable of monitoring and completing a variety of projects simultaneously.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong interpersonal skills.

  • Proven ability to work well in a deadline oriented, client-driven environment.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.
